contentrichtext.text: '''Valentinian''' was the name of several [[Roman emperor]]s: * [[Valentinian I]] (321–375), Roman emperor from 364 to 375, son of [[Gratian the Elder]], commonly known as Valentinian the Great * [[Valentinian II]] (371–392), Roman Emperor from 375 to 392 * [[Valentinian III]] (419–455), Western Roman Emperor from 425 to 455 ==Other== * [[Valentinian (play)]], a Jacobean era stage play *[[Valentinus (Gnostic)|Valentinius]], gnostic theologian and founder of Valentinianism, sometimes known as Valentinian *[[Valentinian dynasty]], Imperial Roman dynasty founded by Valentinian I ==See also== *[[Valentine]], an Anglicization of ''Valentinian'', ''Valentinus'', and ''Valentinius'' *[[Valentinus]] {{hndis}}
